result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas Paul Kruger

defendant.name: Kruger, Nicholas Paul
defendant.address: N7345 Mariner Hills Cir, Elkhorn, WI 53121

records.addlTxt:
3:00pm Court in session

Defendant Nicholas Kruger present in court with attorney Obi Uzowulu. ADA Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Matter is set for trial on Monday, parties have an agreement. Atty Uzowulu puts agreement on the record. 
State is in compliance with victims rights, victim is present in court with victim/witness coordinator

Plea questionnaire filed with the Court
Court has plea colloquy with Deft. 
Court reminds Deft of maximum penalties, Deft acknowledges. 
Court gives warnings as to deportation, voting ineligibility & firearm restriction. Deft acknowledges


Deft pleads guilty to Ct #1 in 21CF528

Court finds factual basis exists, adjudges Deft guilty & adopts the agreement of the parties. 
Victim does not wish to make statement.
Deft apologizes to the Court. 

Court makes record & sentences Deft

21CF528
Ct #1-

withheld sentence 
2 years probation 

Conditions of probation to include:

Payment of all costs, fees & surcharges
45 days jail with work release, to commence on/before 8am on 6/13/22
$200 fine plus costs
Pay restitution, if any is claimed (held open 60 days)
AODA assessment and follow through with recommended counseling
Counseling as recommended by the probation agent
No contact with victim without victim and probation agent's consent 
No weapons 
No alcohol 
No drugs/paraphernalia
No contact with Bernie's Pub in Elkhorn, WI
Provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge

All other counts & cases are dismissed & read-in. 

Nothing further from the parties.

3:08pm Court in recess
Petition for Appointment of Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency

ADA Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Attoreny Leah Selmek appears for Atty Uzowulu. Defendant in court. Matter on for Final Pre Trial. Speedy demand has been made on behalf of victim. Defense is requesting reset to obtain expert medical documents. Defendant is agreeing with rese. State objects due to victim's speedy demand. State would request a motion. Court can not reset due to victim's speedy demand; Motion to be filed. Matter remains as scheduled. Offers conveyed. Discovery completed. Witnesses available. 2 alternates; 5 strikes. Jurors may take notes; no questions. Jury instructions due Friday before and court to begin at 830 am.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
records.descr: Notice of motion and motion for discovery

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court
Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved.

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Nicholas Paul Kruger appeared in court with attorney Obi Uzowulu. Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Minutes filed.

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Nicholas Paul Kruger appeared in court. Attorney Obi Uzowulu for Nicholas Paul Kruger appeared in court. Reading of complaint waived. Defendant given complaint; charges/penalties explained by the court. Minutes filed.
Waiver of Prelim scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

James Sempf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Defendant Nicholas Paul Kruger appeared in court, in custody by video with Attorney Leah Selmek, specially. Bond remains. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Order to seal notice of arrest
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH B.D. (dob 8/4/1979) OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
